description.value:
Trigger A creature attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Force Open] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Pick a Lock]{Pick the Lock} on the eastern door, or ends a turn in this room while not performing the candle-lighting ritual

Effect A glowing red eye manifests in the ceiling mounted orb to stare angrily at the triggering creature, who must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:46] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Frightened]{Frightened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Frightened]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure). The Trial of the Gods then rolls initiative.

details.description: What appears to be an eye opens within the glowing orb near the ceiling.
details.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:43] (master) to deactivate the glowing orb and prevent it from observing the room, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Dispel Magic] (9th rank; counteract DC 36) to counteract the trial, @Check[religion|dc:45] (master) to perform a complex 5-round candle-lighting ritual, or placing General Ordulf's religious symbol on an empty hook on any wall as an Interact action
details.reset: Once the room is empty of creatures, the trial deactivates and then resets after 1 minute has passed.
details.routine: (1 action; death, emotion, fear, mental) The red eye glances at a randomly determined creature in area B3 that it can see and is not engaged in a candle-lighting ritual, then casts a 9th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Vision of Death] on that target, causing them to experience the sight of Achaekek rising up from the ground to smite the transgressor for failing to honor the gods.
